title.narrative: Federal Trade Commission: Technical Assistance to India on Competition

description.narrative: Federal Trade Commission (FTC) assistance to foreign antitrust agencies aimed at ensuring that competition agencies in developing and transitional economies that review suspected anticompetitive conduct and mergers share in a convergent approach to enforcement, analysis, and fairness, with a secondary goal of promoting competition in the economy at-large and cross-border cooperation.

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Federal Trade Commission, Salaries and Expenses
Federal Trade Commission, Salaries and Expenses

title.narrative: Federal Trade Commission: Technical Assistance to India on Consumer Protection

description.narrative: Federal Trade Commission (FTC) assistance to foreign consumer protection and privacy agencies aimed at building a foundation for strong cooperative relationships between the FTC and newer consumer protection agencies with an eye to building the capacity of those agencies to serve as effective civil law enforcement partners in the fight against cross-border fraud, with the secondary goal of promoting a common vision of sound consumer policy.

title.narrative: Federal Trade Commission: Technical Assistance to India on Consumer Protection, Competition, and Enforcement

description.narrative: The Federal Trade Commission (FTC) works to ensure US consumer protection and advance fair and vibrant economic competition. In an increasingly globalized economy, the FTC seeks to bolster competition and consumer protection around the world to combat deceptive and anticompetitive business practices that affect US customers. Recognizing the need for international engagement to advance consumer protection and free and fair competition, The FTC also reaches out to competition and consumer protection authorities to provide policy leadership, promote sound approaches to common problems, and help new agencies address the challenges of transitioning to a market-based economy.
